results.title: Handel Messiah: the 250th anniversary performance. For ever and ever
results.creator_credit: Barrie Gavin, Keith Cheetham, Tony Boland, Channel 4, Planet 24, Radio-Telefis Eireann (RTE) and Victor Vasarely
results.brief_description: Filmed at the Point Theatre Dublin to mark the 250th anniversary of the premiere of Handel’s great work “The Messiah.” Conducted by Neville Marriner, the Academy of St. Martin-in-the-Fields orchestra and chorus perform the work with solos by Sylvia Mcnair, Anne Sofie von Otter, Michael Chance, Jerry Hadley and Robert Lloyd. There is a documentary entitled “For ever and ever” at the end of the performance which looks at Handel’s Messiah and its history.

results.title: Priest
results.creator_credit: Antonia Bird, George Faber, Josephine Ward, BBC, Electric Pictures (Aust) and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: A young priest tests his faith and vocation when assigned to a working class Parish in Liverpool. When a teenage girl confesses of her father’s incestuous advances, he is torn by the rituals of a Church which swears him to silence and to which he owes obedience, and his innate sense of justice. This conflict is compounded by his struggle with his own desires and sexuality as he enters into an illicit homosexual relationship. Linus Roache is excellent and well supported by a cast including Tom Wilkinson, Cathy Tyson and Robert Carlyle. “Priest” does not seek to attack organised religion; instead it offers a window into the heart and mind of a believer who struggles daily with his faith and vocation to find a true path.

results.title: Whisky galore!
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: An hilarious, fast-paced comedy about a tiny and remote Hebridean island, Todday which is plunged into the depths of despair. Spirits are at zero for Todday is without whisky. Then a World War II ship founders on the rocks and the Scottish islanders guide the crew to safety. The ship’s captain and mate reveal that the cargo was 40,000 cases of whisky bound for America. Delayed for a day because of the Sabbath, the islanders eventually succeed in removing a considerable amount of the cargo and the dawn breaks with a rosy glow on a brighter, happier island, but the whisky does not last forever. Starring Basil Radford and Joan Greenwood. Co-starring James Robertson Justice, Gordon Jackson, Wylie Watson, Catherine Lacey and Jean Cadell. Based on the novel by Compton Mackenzie who has a small role as Captain Buncher. This film was released in the U.S. under the titles “Tight Little Island” and “Mad Little Island.”

results.title: Rain man (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Guber-Peters Company and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: My father has stuck it to me all my life, complains Charlie Babbitt, a callous self-centred young hustler who feels he’s been cheated. After his father’s death, Charlie’s inheritance comprises of prized rose bushes and a vintage ‘49 Buick conertible. Charlie soon uncovers yet another surprise - a brother he never knew he had. Dustin Hoffman’s Oscar winning portrayal of Raymond, an autistic savant living in a world devoid of human perceptions, may well be the crowning achievement of his distinguished career. Discovering Raymond in an institution, Charlie abducts him in a last ditch effort to extort his ‘“fair share” of the family estate. What begins as an unsentimental journey across the country, evolves into a mystical odyssey of love and self revelation as Raymond forces Charlie to grow beyond the limits of his own handicapped heart. Stars Dustin Hoffman and Tom Cruise.

results.title: Saraband for dead lovers
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Sir Michael Balcon, Ealing Studios and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
George the Ist of England came from the small independent German state of Hanover and when he succeeded to the throne of England, he left behind a prisoner in the Castle of Ahlden, Princess Sophia Dorothea, his wife. She married George Louis against her will and this is a tragic tale full of melodrama, intrigue and spectacle. The costumes and settings alike will delight. Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay, Flora Robson, Anthony Quayle and Michael Gough star in this period drama based on a novel by Helen Simpson.

results.title: Look up and laugh
results.creator_credit: Basil Dean, ATP and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Great English songbird Gracie Fields stars as touring variety artist Grace Pearson. Grace expects a happy time at home after a long tour. When she returns, all she meets is doom and gloom. Belfer, the owner of a big store is at war with the local market stallholders, one of whom is Grace’s father. Belfer wants to close the market and extend his shop. Matters become complicated as Belfer’s daughter and Grace’s brother fall in love. At Grace’s suggestion, the market stallholders organise a barricade in order to win the day. Starring Douglas Wakefield, Harry Tate and Vivien Leigh in this classic Ealing production. J.B. Priestly wrote the screenplay.

results.title: Capricorn one
results.creator_credit: Peter Hyams, Paul N Lazarus and Associated General Films
results.brief_description: The world waits for the first manned space flight to Mars. Before the countdown ends, the three astronauts become part of an elaborate hoax designed to fool the American public. A journalist (Elliot Gould) uncovers the plot and the astronauts are plunged into a battle of wits in order to survive. Hal Holbrook plays the director of NASA who engineers the hoax, while Sam Waterston, James Brolin and O.J. Simpson play the doomed spacemen. Closer to a thriller in genre than science fiction, the film’s ingenious plot concept does not compensate for its obvious flaws such as the complete character turnaround by Holbrook, who goes from a man acting on his beliefs, to an evil genius who will stop at nothing to carry out his plot.

results.title: Hue and cry
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Henry Cornelius, Sir Michael Balcon, Ealing Studios and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
While reading a hair-rasing serial in the magazine “The Trump”, 15 year-old Joe Kirby finds that his over-active imagination has exceeded itself and he lands right in the middle of the story. Joe convinces himself and friends that the magazine installments are being used as a means of secret communication by a masterly gang of criminals. Starring Alastair Sim, Jack Warner, Valerie White and Jack Lambert.

results.title: The Doors
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho, Bill Graham, Sasha Harari, Bill Graham Films and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: With this biography of rock group The Doors, and in particular the excesses of lead singer and poet Jim Morrison, Oliver Stone’s obesession with documenting the cultural shifts in America in the 1960s found its perfect subject. Val Kilmer is engaging as Morrison, a young film student who becomes attracted to the promise and liberation of acid-tinged Haight-Ashbury. The formation of The Doors coincided with the LSD experimentation and the counter-cultural revolution in the American underground. Stone traces the band’s increasing popularity, their acceptance by the New York avant-garde, including Warhol’s Factory and Morrison’s decline through drug-abuse. As the band falls apart, only Morrison’s identification with Native American spirituality offers an escape from the materialist Hell he is in. This intense and kinetic film is both a celebration of counter-cultural revolution and a sad lament for its corruption. Co-starring Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan, Michael Madsen and a cameo by Billy Idol.

results.title: Like any child
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn and Cradle Mountain Film Productions for Department of Health and Community Services Specialist Children's Services Unit and The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.brief_description: Profiles a day in the professional life of two early childhood educators as they include a child with a disability in their centre. We follow their daily routine; seeing how they create a positive environment to encourage interaction between the children and how thoughtful planning enables all children to participate in the program. Accompanied by 3p. Discussion Notes and 47p. training manual entitled “Like any child: planning for children with disabilities.”
